column5: Hi,   My son and I went to Horseshoe lake today south of Parry. Sound 1,st time on lake. On Lake at 6 am. Off t 1 pm. It was hot,  we covered the whole lake. Nothing not even  a small htt. Went shallow, went deep Apparently there is bass in there(.  ( so I've been told) Any pointers. That anyone can give Thanks
I only fished there one time. I do remember some bass being caught around the islands, and a big honkin pike that only made it to boatside

http://www.adventurefishingmaps.on.ca/horseshoelakefishingmap.htm  " major fish species include large and smallmouth bass, northern pike, rainbow trout and cisco (lake herring) "  Never been there, looks good on a map though, the ones I saw didn't have depth contours though, lots of points, coves, and possibly weedy areas.
More of an early season fishery (At least for me)
